page.title: 03CONSERVATION
page.content: Ashwell has ben officially designated as a {conservation area.}The local council wants to keep the village looking like it does today. In 1985 it carried out a{Local Plan}consultation so that villagers had a say in future planning. Strict controls are applied to any new development. New works must{blend in}with the existing architecture and not disturb the conservation area. Ashwell residents strongly support this policy. There are signs that the conservation policy is working. Recent new developments, like Silverlees, have been architecturally sympathetic and the disused{Dixie's Farm}buildings have found new uses as shops or light engineering units. Open space has not been lost and infill housing has been well controlled.
